div.p: The Ludington Area School district, in partnership with parents and community, will educate and empower students to adapt and succeed in their futures.
Ludington Area School students will graduate from a top-performing district, confident in the skills required for their success in the global community.

hr.h3: Construction information for potential bidders on construction project
hr.p: If your company is interested in bidding on parts of the Ludington Area School District's upcoming construction projects please contact the Christman Company, specifically Ben Globke at: ben.globke@christmanco.com Ben has knowledge of the timing of the bidding categories and be able to provide the information that subcontractors will need. The bidding timeframe will be during the winter of 2020, construction will begin in Spring 2020, prior to bidding Christman will host a local subcontractor event to recruit and solicit contractors from the Ludington/Mason County area.

div.div: LHS Earns Recognition in Fourth Consecutive Year

div.p: The U.S. News & World Report describes a great high school as one that “educates all students from different social and economic backgrounds, exposing them to challenging coursework on the path to graduation.” The highest ranked public schools in the publication’s list of Best High Schools in 2020 are those schools whose “attendees demonstrated outstanding outcomes above expectations in math and reading state assessments, passed a diverse array of college-level exams and graduated students in high proportions.”

a.aria-label: LHS Earns Recognition in Fourth Consecutive Year

div.p: The students and families of the Ludington Area School District continue to be on our minds as we work through this state mandated and unprecedented, yet necessary, closing of our school buildings. The District is offering an opportunity to connect with our families while surveying the needs of our school community, and collecting feedback on the operation of our programs during this time.

div.div: District Mourns the Loss of Teacher

div.p: Dear LASD Family and School Community:

As you may be aware, Ms. Cindy Jarvie, a 1st grade teacher at Lakeview Elementary School, passed away last evening after a hard fought battle with cancer. Our thoughts and prayers continue to go out to Ms. Jarvie’s family and to our students, staff, and all of those affected by her passing. Ms. Jarvie’s passing has had a tremendous impact on our staff and school community.

a.aria-label: District Mourns the Loss of Teacher

div.div: Use school network to update iPads

div.p: If you are using a hotspot at home or have spotty internet there are many spots around the schools where you can safely pull in, stay in your car, and use the school's network to complete the update to your student's iPad.

a.title: View more about State Mandated School Closure

div.div: Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, Governor Whitmer has made it mandatory for all schools in Michigan to close from March 16th through June 30th. See www.LASD.net for more information.
